<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>
<A NAME="tx91906_47"></A>GLOSSARY </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Anchor bottlers</B>:
The Pepsi Bottling Group (PBG), PepsiAmericas, Inc. (PAS) and Pepsi Bottling Ventures (PBV). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Bottler</B>: customers who we have granted exclusive contracts to sell and manufacture certain beverage products bearing our trademarks within a specific geographical area. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Bottler funding</B>: financial incentives we give to our bottlers to
assist in the distribution and promotion of our beverage products. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3"><B>Business Process Transformation (BPT)</B>: our comprehensive multi-year effort to drive efficiencies. It includes efforts to physically consolidate, or integrate, key business functions to take advantage of our scale. It also includes
moving to a common set of processes that underlie our key activities, and supporting them with common technology application. And finally, it includes our SAP installation, the computer system that will link all of our systems and processes.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Concentrate Shipments and Equivalents (CSE)</B>: measure of
our physical beverage volume to our customers. This measure is reported on our fiscal year basis. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Consumers</B>: people who eat and drink our products. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Customers</B>: franchise bottlers and independent distributors and retailers. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>CSD</B>: carbonated soft drinks. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Derivatives</B>: financial instruments that we use to manage our risk arising from changes in commodity prices, interest rates, foreign exchange rates
and stock prices. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Direct-Store-Delivery (DSD)</B>: delivery
system used by us and our bottlers to deliver snacks and beverages directly to retail stores where our products are merchandised. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Effective net pricing</B>: reflects the year-over-year impact of discrete pricing actions, sales incentive activities and mix resulting from selling
varying products in different package sizes and in different countries. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3"><B>Management operating cash flow</B>: net cash provided by operating activities less capital spending plus sales of property, plant and equipment. It is our primary measure used to monitor cash flow performance. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Marketplace spending</B>:<B> </B>sales incentives offered through various
programs to our customers and consumers, as well as advertising and other marketing activities. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">96 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Servings</B>: common metric reflecting our consolidated physical unit volume. Our divisions&#146;
physical unit measures are converted into servings based on U.S. Food and Drug Administration guidelines for single-serving sizes of our products. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%; text-indent:-2%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Smart Spot</B>:<B> </B>our initiative that helps consumers find our products that can contribute to healthier lifestyles. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Transaction gains and losses</B>: the impact on our consolidated
financial statements of exchange rate changes arising from specific transactions. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Translation adjustments</B>: the impact of the conversion of our foreign affiliates&#146; financial statements to U.S. dollars for the purpose of consolidating our financial statements. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">97 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>
<A NAME="toc91906_12"></A>Item&nbsp;7A. Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Included in
<A HREF="#toc91906_11">Item&nbsp;7. Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis &#150; Our Business Risks</A>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>
<A NAME="toc91906_13"></A>Item&nbsp;8. Financial Statements and Supplementary Data </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">See
<A HREF="#toc91906_24">Item&nbsp;15. Exhibits and Financial Statement Schedules</A>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3"><B>
<A NAME="toc91906_14"></A>Item&nbsp;9. Changes in and Disagreements With Accountants on Accounting and Financial Disclosure </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Not applicable. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>
<A NAME="toc91906_15"></A>Item&nbsp;9A. Controls and Procedures </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3"><B><I>Disclosure Controls and Procedures. </I></B>As of the end of the period covered by this report, we carried out an evaluation, under the supervision and with the participation of our management, including our Chief Executive Officer
and Chief Financial Officer, of the effectiveness of the design and operation of our disclosure controls and procedures, as such term is defined in Rule 13a-15(e) of the Exchange Act. Based upon that evaluation, our Chief Executive Officer and Chief
Financial Officer concluded that our disclosure controls and procedures are effective in alerting them on a timely basis to information required to be included in our submissions and filings with the SEC. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">
<A NAME="tx91906_52"></A><B><I>Management&#146;s Report on Internal Control over Financial Reporting. </I></B>Our management is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over financial reporting, as such term is defined
in Rule 13a-15(f) of the Exchange Act. Under the supervision and with the participation of our management, including our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, we conducted an evaluation of the effectiveness of our internal control
over financial reporting based upon the framework in <I>Internal Control &#150; Integrated Framework</I> issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission. Based on that evaluation, our management concluded that our
internal control over financial reporting is effective as of December&nbsp;31, 2005. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">KPMG LLP, an independent registered public accounting firm, has audited the consolidated financial statements included in this Annual Report on Form 10-K and, as part of their audit, has issued their report, included
herein, (1)&nbsp;on our management&#146;s assessment of the effectiveness of our internal controls over financial reporting and (2)&nbsp;on the effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>Changes in Internal Control over Financial Reporting. </I></B>There
were no changes in our internal control over financial reporting that have materially affected, or are reasonably likely to materially affect, our internal control over financial reporting during our fourth fiscal quarter of 2005. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>
<A NAME="toc91906_16"></A>Item&nbsp;9B. Other Information </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3">Not applicable. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>
<A NAME="toc91906_17"></A>PART III </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>
<A NAME="toc91906_18"></A>Item&nbsp;10. Directors and Executive Officers of the Registrant </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The name, age and background of each of our directors nominated for election are contained under the caption &#147;Election of Directors&#148; in our Proxy Statement for our 2006 Annual Meeting
of Shareholders and are incorporated herein by reference. Pursuant to Item&nbsp;401(b) of Regulation S-K, our executive officers are reported under the caption &#147;
<A HREF="#tx91906_53">Our Executive Officers</A>&#148; in Part I of this report. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Information on the beneficial ownership reporting for our directors and executive officers is contained under the caption &#147;Section 16(a) Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance&#148; in our Proxy Statement for
our 2006 Annual Meeting of Shareholders and is incorporated herein by reference. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Information on our audit committee financial experts is contained in our Proxy Statement for our 2006 Annual Meeting of Shareholders under the caption &#147;Corporate Governance at PepsiCo&#148; and is incorporated
herein by reference. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">We have a written code of conduct that
applies to all of our employees, including our directors, Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer and Controller. Our Worldwide Code of Conduct was distributed to all employees, is available on our website at <U>http://www.pepsico.com</U>
and is included as Exhibit 14 to our 2003 Annual Report on Form 10-K. A copy of our Worldwide Code of Conduct may be obtained free of charge by writing to Investor Relations, 700 Anderson Hill Road, Purchase, New York 10577. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Our business and affairs are overseen by our Board of Directors pursuant to
the North Carolina Business Corporation Act and our By-Laws. The Board of Directors has three standing committees: Audit, Compensation and Nominating and Corporate Governance. The charters of these committees are available free of charge on our
website at <U>http://www.pepsico.com</U>. The names of each of our Audit Committee members are contained in our Proxy Statement for our 2006 Annual Meeting of Shareholders under the caption &#147;The Audit Committee&#148; and are incorporated herein
by reference. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>
<A NAME="toc91906_19"></A>Item&nbsp;11. Executive Compensation </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3">Information on compensation of our directors and executive officers is contained in our Proxy Statement for our 2006 Annual Meeting of Shareholders under the captions &#147;Directors&#146; Compensation&#148; and &#147;Executive
Compensation,&#148; respectively, and is incorporated herein by reference. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">99 </FONT></P>

STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>SECURITIES AUTHORIZED FOR ISSUANCE UNDER EQUITY </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">As of May&nbsp;7, 2003, the shareholder-approved 2003 Long-Term Incentive Plan (the &#147;2003 LTIP&#148;) superseded all of our other equity compensation plans
and is the only equity compensation plan under which future awards are permitted. All of our other equity compensation plans were terminated on May&nbsp;7, 2003. The 2003 LTIP permits the award of stock options, stock appreciation rights, restricted
shares, and restricted stock and/or performance units, which may be settled in shares of PepsiCo Common Stock. As approved by shareholders, the 2003 LTIP authorizes a number of shares for issuance equal to 70,000,000 plus the number of shares
underlying awards issued under the Company&#146;s other equity compensation plans which are canceled or expire after May&nbsp;7, 2003; provided, however, that the number of shares authorized under the 2003 LTIP will not exceed 85,000,000.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Includes the 2003 LTIP, the 1994 Long-Term Incentive Plan, and the 1987 Incentive Plan. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">100 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(5)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The table does not include information for equity compensation plans assumed by PepsiCo in connection with PepsiCo&#146;s merger with The Quaker Oats Company.
Those plans include the Quaker Long Term Incentive Plan of 1990, the Quaker Long Term Incentive Plan of 1999 and the Quaker Stock Compensation Plan for Outside Directors (collectively, the &#147;Quaker Plans&#148;). As of December&nbsp;31, 2005, a
total of 2,593,962 shares of PepsiCo Common Stock were issuable upon the exercise of outstanding options which were granted under the Quaker Plans prior to the merger with PepsiCo. The weighted-average exercise price of those options is $23.26 per
share. An additional 50,136 shares of PepsiCo Common Stock which are related to awards issued under the Quaker Plans prior to the merger have been deferred and will be issued in the future. No additional options or shares may be granted under the
Quaker Plans. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(6)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">For options only. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>1995 Stock Option Incentive Plan (&#147;SOIP&#148;)</I></B><B>.</B> The SOIP was adopted by the Board of Directors on July&nbsp;27, 1995. Under the
SOIP, stock options were granted to middle management employees generally based on a multiple of base salary. SOIP options were granted with an exercise price equal to the fair market value of PepsiCo Common Stock on the date of grant. SOIP options
generally become exercisable at the end of three years and have a ten-year term. At year-end 2005, options covering 20,919,909 shares of PepsiCo Common Stock were outstanding under the SOIP. As of May&nbsp;7, 2003 the SOIP was terminated. The SOIP
is included as Exhibit 10.14 in our 2002 Annual Report on Form 10-K, filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on March&nbsp;7, 2003. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>SharePower Stock Option Plan</I></B><B>.</B> SharePower was adopted by the Board of Directors on July&nbsp;1, 1989. Under SharePower, options were
generally granted each year to virtually all of our full-time employees based on a formula tied to annual earnings and tenure. Each year, the Board of Directors authorized the number of shares required to grant options under the SharePower formula.
SharePower options were granted with an exercise price equal to the fair market value of PepsiCo Common Stock on the date of grant. SharePower options generally become exercisable after three years and have a ten-year term. At year-end 2005, options
covering 27,242,216 shares of PepsiCo Common Stock were outstanding under SharePower. As of May&nbsp;7, 2003, the SharePower plan was terminated and superseded by the 2003 LTIP, from which all future SharePower awards will be made. The SharePower
plan is included as Exhibit 10.13 in our 2002 Annual Report on Form 10-K, filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on March&nbsp;7, 2003. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>Director Stock Plan</I></B><B>. </B>The Director Stock Plan was adopted by the disinterested members of the Board of Directors on July&nbsp;28,
1988. Under the Director Stock Plan, stock options were granted and shares of PepsiCo Common Stock were issued to non-employee directors. Options granted under the plan were immediately exercisable and have a ten-year term. As of year-end 2005,
options covering 480,787 shares of PepsiCo Common Stock with exercise prices ranging from $30.125 to $51.50 were outstanding under the Director Stock Plan. The Director Stock Plan is included in Post-Effective Amendment No.&nbsp;6 to the Form S-8
related to such plan, filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on September&nbsp;4, 2002. As of May&nbsp;7, 2003, the Director Stock Plan was </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">101 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">terminated and superseded by the 2003 LTIP, from which all future Director stock options will be granted.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Information on the number of shares of PepsiCo Common Stock
beneficially owned by each director and by all directors and officers as a group is contained under the caption &#147;Ownership of PepsiCo Common Stock by Directors and Executive Officers&#148; in our Proxy Statement for our 2006 Annual Meeting of
Shareholders and is incorporated herein by reference. As far as we know, no person beneficially owns more than 5% of the outstanding shares of PepsiCo Common or Convertible Preferred Stock. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>
<A NAME="toc91906_21"></A>Item&nbsp;13. Certain Relationships and Related Transactions </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Not applicable. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>
<A NAME="toc91906_22"></A>Item&nbsp;14. Principal Accountant Fees and Services </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Information on our audit committee&#146;s pre-approval policy for audit services, and information on our principal accountant fees and services is contained in our Proxy Statement for our 2006 Annual Meeting of
Shareholders under the captions &#147;Audit Committee Report&#148; and &#147;Audit and Non-Audit Fees,&#148; and is incorporated herein by reference. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">102 </FONT></P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>
<A NAME="toc91906_23"></A>PART IV </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>
<A NAME="toc91906_24"></A>Item&nbsp;15. Exhibits and Financial Statement Schedules </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="89%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" NOWRAP> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a)1.&nbsp;and&nbsp;2.</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Financial Statements</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The following consolidated financial statements of PepsiCo, Inc. and its affiliates are included herein by reference to the pages indicated on the
<A HREF="#toc91906_11">index</A> appearing in
<A HREF="#tx91906_107">Item&nbsp;7</A>. Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis:</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="5"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>ARTICLE XI &#150; AUTHENTICATION</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>42</B></FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">-iii- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">ARTICLE I &#150; INTRODUCTION </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">PepsiCo, Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;) established the PepsiCo Executive Income Deferral Program (the
&#147;Plan&#148;) in 1972 to permit Eligible Executives to defer certain cash awards made under its executive compensation programs. Subsequently, the Plan has been amended and expanded from time to time. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">This document is effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2005 (the
&#147;Effective Date&#148;). It sets forth the terms of the Plan that are applicable to deferrals that are subject to Section&nbsp;409A, <I>i.e.</I>, generally, deferred amounts that are earned or vested after December&nbsp;31, 2004 (the &#147;409A
Program&#148;). Other deferrals under the Plan shall be governed by a separate set of documents that set forth the pre-Section&nbsp;409A terms of the Plan (the &#147;Pre-409A Program&#148;). Together, this document and the documents for the Pre-409A
Program describe the terms of a single plan. However, amounts subject to the terms of this 409A Program and amounts subject to the terms of the Pre-409A Program shall be tracked separately at all times. The preservation of the terms of the Pre-409A
Program, without material modification, and the separation between the 409A Program amounts and the Pre-409A Program amounts are intended to be sufficient to permit the pre-409A Program to remain exempt from Section&nbsp;409A. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">With respect to deferrals covered by this document, this
document specifies the group of executives of the Company and certain affiliated employers that are eligible to make deferrals, the procedures for electing to defer compensation and the Plan&#146;s provisions for maintaining and paying out amounts
that have been deferred. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The Plan is unfunded
and unsecured. Amounts deferred by an executive are a liability and an obligation of that executive&#146;s individual employer. With respect to his or her employer, the executive has the rights of a general creditor. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">1 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">ARTICLE II &#150; DEFINITIONS </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">When used in this Plan, the following underlined terms shall have the meanings set forth below unless a
different meaning is plainly required by the context: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.01
<U>Account</U>: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The account maintained for a
Participant on the books of his or her Employer to determine, from time to time, the Participant&#146;s interest under this Plan. The balance in such Account shall be determined by the Recordkeeper pursuant to any guidelines established by the Plan
Administrator. Each Participant&#146;s Account shall consist of at least one Deferral Subaccount for each separate deferral under Section&nbsp;4.01. In accordance with Section&nbsp;5.05, some or all of a separate deferral may be held in a Risk of
Forfeiture Subaccount. The Recordkeeper may also establish such additional Deferral Subaccounts as it deems necessary for the proper administration of the Plan. Except as provided in Section&nbsp;5.05, the Recordkeeper may also combine Deferral
Subaccounts to the extent it deems separate accounts are not needed for sound recordkeeping. Where appropriate, a reference to a Participant&#146;s Account shall include a reference to each applicable Deferral Subaccount that has been established
thereunder. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.02 <U>Act</U>: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.03 <U>Base Compensation</U>: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">An Eligible Executive&#146;s adjusted base salary, as
determined by the Plan Administrator and to the extent paid in U.S. dollars from an Employer&#146;s U.S. payroll. Subject to the next sentence, for any applicable payroll period, an Eligible Executive&#146;s adjusted base salary shall be determined
after reductions for applicable tax withholdings, tax levies, garnishments, other legally required deductions, and Executive authorized deductions that are (i)&nbsp;for charitable contributions, or (ii)&nbsp;made under any Code Section&nbsp;401(k)
or Code Section&nbsp;125 plans sponsored by the Executive&#146;s Employer or the Company. Notwithstanding the preceding sentence, an Eligible Executive&#146;s Base Compensation may be reduced by an item described in the preceding sentence only to
the extent such reduction does not violate Section&nbsp;409A. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3">2.04 <U>Beneficiary</U>: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The person
or persons (including a trust or trusts) properly designated by a Participant, as determined by the Plan Administrator, to receive the amounts in one or more of the Participant&#146;s Deferral Subaccounts in the event of the Participant&#146;s
death, provided such person or persons are living (or in existence, in the case of a trust) at the Participant&#146;s death. To be effective, any Beneficiary designation must be in writing, signed by the Participant, and must meet such other
standards (including any requirement for spousal </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">consent) as the Plan Administrator or the Recordkeeper shall require from time to time. The Beneficiary designation must also be filed with the Recordkeeper
(or the Plan Administrator for periods prior to June&nbsp;3, 2002) prior to the Participant&#146;s death. An incomplete Beneficiary designation, as determined by the Recordkeeper or Plan Administrator, shall be void and of no effect. If some but not
all of the persons designated by a Participant to receive his or her Account at death predecease the Participant, the Participant&#146;s surviving Beneficiaries shall be entitled to the portion of the Participant&#146;s Account intended for such
pre-deceased persons in proportion to the surviving Beneficiaries&#146; respective shares. If no designation is in effect at the time of a Participant&#146;s death (as determined by the Plan Administrator) or if all persons designated as
Beneficiaries have predeceased the Participant, then the Participant&#146;s Beneficiary shall be his or her estate. In determining whether a Beneficiary designation that relates to the Plan is in effect, unrevoked designations that were received
prior to the Effective Date of the 409A Program shall be considered. A Beneficiary designation of an individual by name remains in effect regardless of any change in the designated individual&#146;s relationship to the Participant. Solely for
periods prior to June&nbsp;3, 2002, a Beneficiary designation solely by relationship (for example, a designation of &#147;spouse,&#148; that does not give the name of the spouse) shall designate whoever is the person in that relationship to the
Participant at his or her death. However, any Beneficiary designation submitted to the Recordkeeper from and after June&nbsp;3, 2002 that only specifies a Beneficiary by relationship shall not be considered an effective Beneficiary designation and
shall be void and of no effect. An individual who is otherwise a Beneficiary with respect to a Participant&#146;s Account ceases to be a Beneficiary when all payments have been made from the Account. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.05 <U>Bonus Compensation</U>: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">An Eligible Executive&#146;s adjusted annual incentive award
under his or her Employer&#146;s annual incentive plan or the Executive Incentive Compensation Plan, as determined and adjusted by the Plan Administrator and to the extent paid in U.S. dollars from an Employer&#146;s U.S. payroll. Subject to the
next sentence, an Eligible Executive&#146;s annual incentive awards shall be adjusted to reduce them for applicable tax withholdings, tax levies, garnishments, other legally required deductions, and Executive authorized deductions that are
(i)&nbsp;for charitable contributions, or (ii)&nbsp;made under any Code Section&nbsp;401(k) or Code Section&nbsp;125 plans sponsored by the Executive&#146;s Employer or the Company. Notwithstanding the preceding sentence, (a)&nbsp;an Eligible
Executive&#146;s Bonus Compensation may be reduced by an item described in the preceding sentence only to the extent such reduction does not violate Section&nbsp;409A, and (b)&nbsp;an Eligible Executive&#146;s premium bonuses (a term that will have
its normal meaning under the compensation practices of the Employer) shall not be included in the definition of Bonus Compensation and shall not be eligible for deferral hereunder. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.06 <U>Code</U>: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended from time to time. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">3 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.07 <U>Company</U>: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">PepsiCo, Inc., a corporation organized and existing under the laws of the State of North Carolina, or its
successor or successors. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.08 <U>Deferral Subaccount</U>:
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">A subaccount of a Participant&#146;s Account
maintained to reflect his or her interest in the Plan attributable to each deferral (or separately tracked portion of a deferral) of Base Compensation and Bonus Compensation, and earnings or losses credited to such subaccount in accordance with
Section&nbsp;5.01(b). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.09 <U>Disability</U>: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">A Participant shall be considered to suffer from a
Disability or be Disabled hereunder if &#150; (i)&nbsp;the Participant is considered to be &#147;disabled&#148; under the PepsiCo Long Term Disability Plan, and (ii)&nbsp;the Participant&#146;s disability meets the duration requirements to qualify
for a distribution on account of Disability in accordance with Section&nbsp;6.06(a). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.10 <U>Distribution Valuation Date</U>: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Each date as specified by the Plan Administrator from time to time as of which Participant Accounts are valued for purposes of a distribution from a Participant&#146;s Account. The current Distribution Valuation Dates
are January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;April&nbsp;1,&nbsp;July&nbsp;1 and October&nbsp;1. Any current Distribution Valuation Date may be changed by the Plan Administrator, provided that such change does not result in a change in when deferrals are paid out that
is impermissible under Section&nbsp;409A. Values are determined as of the close of a Distribution Valuation Date or, if such date is not a business day, as of the close of the following business day. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.11 <U>Election Form</U>: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The form prescribed by the Plan Administrator on which a
Participant specifies the amount of his or her Base Compensation and Bonus Compensation to be deferred and the timing and form of his or her deferral payout, pursuant to the provisions of Article IV. An Election Form need not exist in a paper
format, and it is expressly contemplated that the Plan Administrator may make available for use such technologies, including voice response systems and electronic forms, as it deems appropriate from time to time. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.12 <U>Eligible Executive</U>: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The term, Eligible Executive, shall have the meaning given
to it in Section&nbsp;3.01(c). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">4 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.13 <U>Employer</U>: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The Company, and each division, subsidiary or affiliate of the Company (if any) that are currently
designated as an Employer by the Plan Administrator. An entity shall be an Employer hereunder only for the period that it is (i)&nbsp;so designated by the Plan Administrator, and (ii)&nbsp;a member of the PepsiCo Organization. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.14 <U>ERISA</U>: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Public Law 93-406, the Employee Retirement Income Security
Act of 1974, as amended from time to time. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.15
<U>Executive</U>: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Any person in a salaried
classification of an Employer who (i)&nbsp;is receiving remuneration for personal services rendered in the employment of the Employer, and (ii)&nbsp;is paid in U.S. dollars from the Employer&#146;s U.S. payroll. Notwithstanding the foregoing
sentence, any person meeting the requirements of the foregoing sentence who is working outside the U.S. shall not be included as an Executive hereunder, if applicable local law of the country in which the person is working (<I>e.g.</I>, local law
relating to the payment of compensation) does not permit the person to defer the receipt of compensation that is eligible for deferral hereunder. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.16 <U>409A Program</U>: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The program described in this document. The term &#147;409A Program&#148; is used to identify the portion of the Plan that is subject to
Section&nbsp;409A. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.17 <U>Key Employee</U>: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The individuals identified in accordance with principles set
forth in Subsection (a), as modified by the following provisions of this Section. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) <U>In General</U>. Any Eligible Executive or former Eligible Executive who at any time during the applicable year is &#150; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1) An officer of an Employer having annual compensation greater than $130,000 (as adjusted under Code
Section&nbsp;416(i)(1)); </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) A 5-percent
owner of an Employer; or </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(3) A 1-percent
owner of an Employer having annual compensation of more than $150,000. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">5 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">For purposes of (1)&nbsp;above, no more than 50 employees identified in the order of
their annual compensation (or, if lesser, the greater of 3 employees or 10 percent of the employees) shall be treated as officers. For purposes of this Section, annual compensation means compensation as defined in Code Section&nbsp;415(c)(3). The
Plan Administrator shall determine who is a Key Employee in accordance with Code Section&nbsp;416(i) and the applicable regulations and other guidance of general applicability issued thereunder or in connection therewith (including the provisions of
Code Section&nbsp;416(i)(3) that treat self employed individuals as employees for purposes of this definition); provided, that Code Section&nbsp;416(i)(5) shall not apply in making such determination, and provided further that the applicable year
shall be determined in accordance with Section&nbsp;409A and that any modification of the foregoing definition that applies under Section&nbsp;409A shall be taken into account. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) <U>Operating Rules for 2005</U>. To ensure that the Company does not fail to identify any Key Employees
based on the provisions of Subsection (a), in the case of Separation from Service distributions during the 2005 Plan Year, the Company shall treat as Key Employees all Eligible Executives (and former Eligible Executives) that are classified (or
grandfathered) for any portion of the 2005 Plan Year as Band IV and above. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(c) <U>Operating Rules for 2006 and Later</U>. To ensure that the Company does not fail to identify any Key Employees based on the provisions of Subsection (a), in the case of Separation from Service distributions
from and after January&nbsp;1, 2006, the Company shall treat as Key Employees for the Plan Year of their Separation from Service those individuals who meet the provisions of Paragraph (1)&nbsp;or (2)&nbsp;below (or both). </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1) The Company shall treat as Key
Employees all Eligible Executives (and former Eligible Executives) that are classified (or grandfathered) for any portion of the Plan Year of their Separation from Service as Band IV and above; and </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) The Company shall treat as a Key
Employee any Eligible Executive who would be a Key Employee as of his or her Separation from Service date based on the standards in this Paragraph (2). For purposes of this Paragraph (2), the Company shall determine Key Employees under Subsection
(a)(1) and (3)&nbsp;above based on compensation (as defined in Code Section&nbsp;415(c)(3)) that is taken into account as follows &#150; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(i) If the determination is in connection with a Separation from Service in the first calendar quarter of a Plan Year,
the determination shall be made using compensation earned in the calendar year that is two years prior to the current calendar year (<I>e.g., </I>for a determination made in the first quarter of 2006, compensation earned in the 2004 calendar year
shall be used); and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">6 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(ii) If the determination is in connection with a Separation from
Service in the second, third or fourth calendar quarter of a Plan Year, the determination shall be made using the compensation earned in the prior calendar year (<I>e.g., </I>for a determination made in the second quarter of 2006, compensation
earned in the 2005 calendar year shall be used). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3">In addition, a Participant shall be considered an officer for purposes of Subsection (a)(1), a 5-percent owner for purposes of Subsection (a)(2) or a 1-percent owner for purposes of Subsection (a)(3) with respect to a Separation from
Service distribution, if the Participant was an officer, a 5-percent owner or a 1-percent owner at some point during the calendar year that applies, in accordance with Subparagraphs (i)&nbsp;and (ii)&nbsp;above, in determining the Participant&#146;s
compensation for purposes of that Separation from Service. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3">2.18 <U>NAV</U>: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The net asset value
of a phantom unit in one of the phantom funds offered for investment under the Plan, determined as of any date in the same manner as applies on that date under the actual fund that is the basis of the phantom fund offered by the Plan. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.19 <U>Participant</U>: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Any Executive who is qualified to participate in this Plan
in accordance with Section&nbsp;3.01 and who has an Account. An active Participant is one who is currently deferring under Section&nbsp;4.01. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.20 <U>PepsiCo Organization</U>: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The controlled group of organizations of which the Company is a part, as defined by Code section 414(b) and (c)&nbsp;and the regulations
issued thereunder. An entity shall be considered a member of the PepsiCo Organization only during the period it is one of the group of organizations described in the preceding sentence. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.21 <U>Performance Period</U>: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The 52/53 week fiscal year of the Employer for which Bonus Compensation is calculated and determined. A Performance Period shall be deemed
to relate to the Plan Year in which the Performance Period ends. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3">2.22 <U>Plan</U>: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The PepsiCo
Executive Income Deferral Program, the plan set forth herein and in the Pre-409A Program documents, as it may be amended and restated from time to time (subject to the limitations on amendment that are applicable hereunder and under the Pre-409A
Program). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">7 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.23 <U>Plan Administrator</U>: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors of the Company (Compensation Committee) or its delegate
or delegates, which shall have the authority to administer the Plan as provided in Article VII. As of the Effective Date, the Company&#146;s Senior Vice President, Compensation and Benefits is delegated the responsibility for the operational
administration of the Plan. In turn, the Senior Vice President, Compensation and Benefits has the authority to re-delegate operational responsibilities to other persons or parties. As of the Effective Date, the Senior Vice President, Compensation
and Benefits has re-delegated certain operational responsibilities to the Recordkeeper. However, references in this document to the Plan Administrator shall be understood as referring to the Compensation Committee, the Senior Vice President,
Compensation and Benefits and those delegated by the Senior Vice President, Compensation and Benefits other than the Recordkeeper. All delegations made under the authority granted by this Section are subject to Section&nbsp;7.06. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.24 <U>Plan Year</U>: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The 12-consecutive month period beginning on January&nbsp;1
and ending on December&nbsp;31. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.25 <U>Pre-409A Program</U>:
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The portion of the Plan that governs
deferrals that are not subject to Section&nbsp;409A. The terms of the Pre-409A Program are set forth in a separate set of documents. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.26 <U>Prohibited Misconduct</U>: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Any of the following activities engaged in, directly or indirectly, by a Participant shall constitute Prohibited Misconduct &#150;
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) The Participant accepting any
employment, assignment, position or responsibility, or acquiring any ownership interest, which involves the Participant&#146;s participation in a business entity that markets, sells, distributes or produces &#147;Covered Products&#148; (as defined
below), unless such business entity makes retail sales or consumes Covered Products without in any way competing with the PepsiCo Organization. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) The Participant, directly or indirectly (including through someone else acting on the Participant&#146;s recommendation, suggestion,
identification or advice), soliciting any PepsiCo Organization employee to leave the PepsiCo Organization&#146;s employment or to accept any position with any other entity. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(c) The Participant using or disclosing to anyone any confidential information regarding the PepsiCo
Organization other than as necessary in his or her position with the PepsiCo Organization. Such confidential information shall include all non-public information the Participant acquired as a result of his or her positions with the PepsiCo </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">8 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Organization which might be of any value to a competitor of the PepsiCo Organization, or which might cause any economic loss or substantial embarrassment to
the PepsiCo Organization or its customers, bottlers, distributors or suppliers if used or disclosed. Examples of such confidential information include non-public information about the PepsiCo Organization&#146;s customers, suppliers, distributors
and potential acquisition targets; its business operations and structure; its product lines, formulas and pricing; its processes, machines and inventions; its research and know-how; its financial data; and its plans and strategies. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(d) The Participant engaging in any acts that are
considered to be contrary to the PepsiCo Organization&#146;s best interests, including violating the Company&#146;s Code of Conduct, engaging in unlawful trading in the securities of the Company or of any other company based on information gained as
a result of his or her employment with the PepsiCo Organization, or engaging in any other activity which constitutes gross misconduct. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(e) The Participant engaging in any activity that constitutes fraud. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">For purposes of this Section, Covered Products shall mean any produce that falls into one or more of the
following categories, so long as the PepsiCo Organization is producing, marketing, selling or licensing such product anywhere in the world &#150; beverages, including carbonated soft drinks, tea, water, juice drinks, sports drinks and coffee drinks;
juices; snacks, including salty snacks, sweet snacks and cookies; or any product or service that the Participant had reason to know was under development by the PepsiCo Organization during the Participant&#146;s employment with the PepsiCo
Organization. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.27 <U>Recordkeeper</U>: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">For any designated period of time, the party that is
delegated the responsibility, pursuant to the authority granted in the definition of Plan Administrator, to maintain the records of Participant Accounts, process Participant transactions and perform other duties in accordance with any procedures and
rules established by the Plan Administrator. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.28
<U>Retirement</U>: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Separation from Service
after attaining eligibility for retirement. A Participant attains eligibility for retirement when he or she attains (whichever of the following occurs earliest) while employed by a member of the PepsiCo Organization: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) At least age 55 with 10 or more years of service,
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) At least age 65 with 5 or more years of
service, or </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(c) If permissible under
Section&nbsp;409A, such other eligibility requirement for special early retirement under the PepsiCo Salaried Employees Retirement Plan or the PepsiCo Pension Equalization Plan as may apply to the Participant. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">9 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">For purposes of this Section, a Participant&#146;s years of service is determined by
reference to the definition of &#147;years of service&#148; for purposes of vesting under the PepsiCo Salaried Employees Retirement Plan (with such definition being applicable whether or not the Participant is actually eligible for the PepsiCo
Salaried Employees Retirement Plan). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.29 <U>Risk of
Forfeiture Subaccount</U>: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The Deferral
Subaccount provided for by Section&nbsp;5.05 to contain the portion of each separate deferral that is subject to forfeiture. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.30 <U>Second Look Election</U>: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The term, Second Look Election, shall have the meaning given to it in Section&nbsp;4.05. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.31 <U>Section&nbsp;409A</U>: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Section&nbsp;409A of the Code and the applicable regulations
and other guidance of general applicability that is issued thereunder. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3">2.32 <U>Separation from Service</U>: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3">A Participant&#146;s separation from service with the PepsiCo Organization, within the meaning of Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(A)(i). The term may also be used as a verb (<I>i.e.</I>, &#147;Separates from Service&#148;) with no change in
meaning. Notwithstanding the preceding sentence, a Participant&#146;s transfer to the Pepsi Bottling Group, Inc. or Pepsi Americas, Inc. shall not be a Separation from Service, if Section&nbsp;409A expressly provides that a transfer to a
pre-designated affiliate is not a Separation from Service. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3">2.33 <U>Specific Payment Date</U>: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">A
specific date selected by an Eligible Executive that triggers a lump sum payment of a deferral or the start of installment payments for a deferral, as provided in Section&nbsp;4.03. The Specific Payment Dates that are available to be selected by
Eligible Executives shall be determined by the Plan Administrator, and the currently available Specific Payment Dates shall be reflected on the Election Forms that are made available from time to time by the Plan Administrator. In the event that an
Election Form only provides for selecting a month and a year as the Specific Payment Date, the first day of the month that is selected shall be the Specific Payment Date. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.34 <U>Unforeseeable Emergency</U>: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">A severe financial hardship to the Participant resulting from &#150; </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) An illness or accident of the
Participant, the Participant&#146;s spouse or a dependent (as defined in Code Section&nbsp;152(a)) of the Participant; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">10 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) Loss of the Participant&#146;s property due to casualty; or </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(c) Any other similar extraordinary and
unforeseeable circumstances arising as a result of events beyond the control of the Participant. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The Recordkeeper shall determine the occurrence of an Unforeseeable Emergency in accordance with Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(B)(ii) and any guidelines established by the Plan Administrator.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.35 <U>Valuation Date</U>: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Each business day, as determined by the Recordkeeper, as of
which Participant Accounts are valued in accordance with Plan procedures that are currently in effect. In accordance with procedures that may be adopted by the Plan Administrator, any current Valuation Date may be changed. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">11 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">ARTICLE III &#150; ELIGIBILITY AND PARTICIPATION </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">3.01 <U>Eligibility to Participate</U>: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) <U>In General</U>. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1) Subject to the special rules for 2005
in Subsection (b), an Executive shall be eligible to defer compensation under the Plan 30 days after (i)&nbsp;being hired by an Employer as an Executive classified as Band&nbsp;II or above (and while he or she remains so classified or grandfathered)
or (ii)&nbsp;being promoted by an Employer from below Band II into a Band II or above position (and while he or she remains so classified or grandfathered). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) Notwithstanding Paragraph (1)&nbsp;above, from time to time the Plan Administrator may modify, limit or expand the
class of Executives eligible to defer hereunder, pursuant to criteria for eligibility that need not be uniform among all or any group of Executives. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
