each Plan Year, this Plan shall be operated (i)&nbsp;in accordance with the requirements of Section&nbsp;409A, and (ii)&nbsp;to preserve the status of deferrals under the Pre- </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">25 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">409A Program as being exempt from Section&nbsp;409A, <I>i.e.</I>, to preserve the grandfathered status of the Pre-409A Program. Any action that may be taken
(and, to the extent possible, any action actually taken) by the Plan Administrator, the Recordkeeper or the Company shall not be taken (or shall be void and without effect), if such action violates the requirements of Section&nbsp;409A or if such
action would adversely affect the grandfather of the Pre-409A Program. If the failure to take an action under the Plan would violate Section&nbsp;409A, then to the extent it is possible thereby to avoid a violation of section 409A, the rights and
effects under the Plan shall be altered to avoid such violation. A corresponding rule shall apply with respect to a failure to take an action that would adversely affect the grandfather of the Pre-409A Program. Any provision in this Plan document
that is determined to violate the requirements of Section&nbsp;409A or to adversely affect the grandfather of the Pre-409A Program shall be void and without effect. In addition, any provision that is required to appear in this Plan document to
satisfy the requirements of Section&nbsp;409A, but that is not expressly set forth, shall be deemed to be set forth herein, and the Plan shall be administered in all respects as if such provision were expressly set forth. A corresponding rule shall
apply with respect to a provision that is required to preserve the grandfather of the Pre-409A Program. In all cases, the provisions of this Section shall apply notwithstanding any contrary provision of the Plan that is not contained in this
Section. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">26 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">ARTICLE VIII &#150; CLAIMS PROCEDURE </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">8.01 <U>Claims for Benefits:</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">If a Participant, Beneficiary or other person (hereafter, &#147;Claimant&#148;) does not receive timely payment of any benefits which
he or she believes are due and payable under the Plan, he or she may make a claim for benefits to the Plan Administrator. The claim for benefits must be in writing and addressed to the Plan Administrator. If the claim for benefits is denied, the
Plan Administrator will notify the Claimant within 90 days after the Plan Administrator initially received the benefit claim. However, if special circumstances require an extension of time for processing the claim, the Plan Administrator will
furnish notice of the extension to the Claimant prior to the termination of the initial 90-day period and such extension may not exceed one additional, consecutive 90-day period. Any notice of a denial of benefits shall advise the Claimant of the
basis for the denial, any additional material or information necessary for the Claimant to perfect his or her claim, and the steps which the Claimant must take to appeal his or her claim for benefits. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">8.02 <U>Appeals of Denied Claims</U>: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Each Claimant whose claim for benefits has been denied may
file a written appeal for a review of his or her claim by the Plan Administrator. The request for review must be filed by the Claimant within 60 days after he or she received the notice denying his or her claim. The decision of the Plan
Administrator will be communicated to the Claimant within 60 days after receipt of a request for appeal. The notice shall set forth the basis for the Plan Administrator&#146;s decision. If special circumstances require an extension of time for
processing the appeal, the Plan Administrator will furnish notice of the extension to the Claimant prior to the termination of the initial 60-day period and such extension may not exceed one additional, consecutive 60-day period. In no event shall
the Plan Administrator&#146;s decision be rendered later than 120 days after receipt of a request for appeal. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">8.03 <U>Special Claims Procedures for Disability Determinations:</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Notwithstanding Sections 8.01 and 8.02 to the contrary, if the claim or appeal of the Claimant relates to Disability benefits, such claim
or appeal shall be processed pursuant to the applicable provisions of Department of Labor Regulation Section&nbsp;2560.503-1 relating to Disability benefits, including Sections 2560.503-1(d), 2560.503-1(f)(3), 2560.503-1(h)(4) and 2560.503-1(i)(3).
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">27 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">ARTICLE IX &#150; AMENDMENT AND TERMINATION </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">9.01 <U>Amendment of Plan:</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors of the Company has the right in its sole discretion to amend this Plan in whole or in
part at any time and in any manner, including the manner of making deferral elections, the terms on which distributions are made, and the form and timing of distributions. However, except for mere clarifying amendments necessary to avoid an
inappropriate windfall, no Plan amendment shall reduce the amount credited to the Account of any Participant as of the date such amendment is adopted. Any amendment shall be in writing and adopted by the Committee. All Participants and Beneficiaries
shall be bound by such amendment. Any amendments made to the Plan shall be subject to any restrictions on amendment that are applicable to ensure continued compliance under Section&nbsp;409A. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">9.02 <U>Termination of Plan</U>: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) The Company expects to continue this Plan, but does not
obligate itself to do so. The Company, acting by the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors, or through its entire Board of Directors, reserves the right to discontinue and terminate the Plan at any time, in whole or in part, for any
reason (including a change, or an impending change, in the tax laws of the United States or any State). Termination of the Plan will be binding on all Participants (and a partial termination shall be binding upon all affected Participants) and their
Beneficiaries, but in no event may such termination reduce the amounts credited at that time to any Participant&#146;s Account. If this Plan is terminated (in whole or in part), the termination resolution shall provide for how amounts theretofore
credited to affected Participants&#146; Accounts will be distributed. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) This Section is subject to the same restrictions related to compliance with Section&nbsp;409A that apply to Section&nbsp;9.01. In accordance with these restrictions, the Company intends to have the maximum
discretionary authority to terminate the Plan and make distributions in connection with a Change in Control (as defined in Section&nbsp;409A), and the maximum flexibility with respect to how and to what extent to carry this out following a Change in
Control (as defined in Section&nbsp;409A) as is permissible under Section&nbsp;409A. The previous sentence contains the exclusive terms under which a distribution may be made in connection with any change in control with respect to deferrals made
under this 409A Program. No distributions shall be made under this 409A Program for any change in control unless the distribution satisfies the provisions of a Change in Control (as defined in Section&nbsp;409A), and no distributions shall be made
under this 409A Program with respect to a &#147;Non-Qualifying Change in Control.&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">28 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(c) For purposes of this Section, a &#147;Non-Qualifying Change in Control&#148; shall
include any of the following &#150; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3">(1) A change in the ownership or effective control of the Company, </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) A change in the ownership of a substantial portion of the assets of the Company, </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(3) Company shareholders approve a merger or consolidation of the Company with another entity and the Company is not the
surviving entity, or if after such transaction, the other entity owns, directly or indirectly, 50% or more of the outstanding voting securities of the Company, </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(4) Company shareholders approve a plan of complete liquidation of the Company or the sale or disposition of all or
substantially all of the Company&#146;s assets, and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(5) Any other event, circumstance, offer or proposal occurs or is made which is intended to effect a change in the control of the Company and which results in the occurrence of one or more of the events listed in
Paragraphs (1)&nbsp;through (4)&nbsp;above. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">29 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">ARTICLE X &#150; MISCELLANEOUS </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">10.01 <U>Limitation on Participant&#146;s Rights</U>: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Participation in this Plan does not give any Participant the right to be retained in the service of the
Company. The Company reserves the right to terminate the service of any Participant without any liability for any claim against the Company under this Plan, except for a claim for payment of deferrals as provided herein. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">10.02 <U>Unfunded Obligation of the Company:</U> </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The benefits provided by this Plan are unfunded. All amounts
payable under this Plan to Participants are paid from the general assets of the Company. Nothing contained in this Plan requires the Company to set aside or hold in trust any amounts or assets for the purpose of paying benefits to Participants.
Neither a Participant, Beneficiary, nor any other person shall have any property interest, legal or equitable, in any specific Company asset. This Plan creates only a contractual obligation on the part of the Company, and the Participant has the
status of a general unsecured creditor of the Company with respect to amounts of compensation deferred hereunder. Such a Participant shall not have any preference or priority over, the rights of any other unsecured general creditor of the Company.
No other Company affiliate guarantees or shares such obligation, and no other Company affiliate shall have any liability to the Participant or his or her Beneficiary. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">10.03 <U>Other Plans:</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">This Plan shall not affect the right of any Eligible Director or Participant to participate in and receive benefits under and in
accordance with the provisions of any other Director compensation plans which are now or hereafter maintained by the Company, unless the terms of such other plan or plans specifically provide otherwise or it would cause such other plan to violate a
requirement for tax favored treatment. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">10.04 <U>Receipt or
Release:</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Any payment to a Participant in
accordance with the provisions of this Plan shall, to the extent thereof, be in full satisfaction of all claims against the Plan Administrator, the Recordkeeper and the Company, and the Plan Administrator may require such Participant, as a condition
precedent to such payment, to execute a receipt and release to such effect. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">10.05 <U>Governing Law:</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">This Plan shall be construed, administered, and governed in all respects in accordance with applicable federal law and, to the extent not preempted by federal law, in accordance with the laws of the State of North
Carolina. If any provisions of this instrument shall be held by a court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions hereof shall continue to be fully effective. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">30 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">10.06 <U>Gender, Tense and Examples:</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">In this Plan, whenever the context so indicates, the singular or plural number and the masculine, feminine,
or neuter gender shall be deemed to include the other. Whenever an example is provided or the text uses the term &#147;including&#148; followed by a specific item or items, or there is a passage having a similar effect, such passage of the Plan
shall be construed as if the phrase &#147;without limitation&#148; followed such example or term (or otherwise applied to such passage in a manner that avoids limitation on its breadth of application). </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">10.07 <U>Successors and Assigns; Nonalienation of Benefits:</U> </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">This Plan inures to the benefit of and is binding upon
the parties hereto and their successors, heirs and assigns; provided, however, that the amounts credited to the Account of a Participant are not (except as provided in Section&nbsp;7.05) subject in any manner to anticipation, alienation, sale,
transfer, assignment, pledge, encumbrance, charge, garnishment, execution or levy of any kind, either voluntary or involuntary, and any attempt to anticipate, alienate, sell, transfer, assign, pledge, encumber, charge or otherwise dispose of any
right to any benefits payable hereunder, including, without limitation, any assignment or alienation in connection with a separation, divorce, child support or similar arrangement, will be null and void and not binding on the Plan or the Company.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Plan Administrator reserves the right to make payments in accordance with a divorce decree, judgment or other court order as and when cash payments are made in accordance with the terms of this Plan from the
Deferral Subaccount of a Participant. Any such payment shall be charged against and reduce the Participant&#146;s Account. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">10.08 <U>Facility of Payment:</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Whenever, in the Plan Administrator&#146;s opinion, a Participant or Beneficiary entitled to receive any payment hereunder is under a
legal disability or is incapacitated in any way so as to be unable to manage his or her financial affairs, the Plan Administrator may direct the Company to make payments to such person or to the legal representative of such person for his or her
benefit, or to apply the payment for the benefit of such person in such manner as the Plan Administrator considers advisable. Any payment in accordance with the provisions of this Section shall be a complete discharge of any liability for the making
of such payment to the Participant or Beneficiary under the Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">31 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">ARTICLE XI &#150; AUTHENTICATION </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">This 409A Program has been authorized, adopted and approved to be effective as stated herein by the
Company&#146;s Board of Directors at its duly authorized meeting held on November&nbsp;18, 2005. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">32 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>APPENDIX </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">This Appendix modifies particular terms of the Plan as it may apply to certain groups and situations. Except as specifically modified
in this Appendix, the foregoing main provisions of the Plan shall fully apply in determining the rights and benefits of Participants. In the event of a conflict between this Appendix and the foregoing main provisions of the Plan, the Appendix shall
govern. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Pursuant to Q&amp;A-20(a) of IRS
Notice 2005-1, each Eligible Director shall have the right to cancel his or her election to defer Director Compensation for the 2004-2005 Board Year. Such election to cancel must be filed with the Plan Administrator prior to the end of the 2004-2005
Board Year and must follow any other procedures and timing requirements established by the Plan Administrator for this purpose (such procedures and timing requirements to be consistent with the requirements of Q&amp;A-20(a)). Any Eligible Director
who makes an election to cancel such deferral election shall have the Director Compensation related to such deferral election paid to him or her (plus any applicable earnings or minus any applicable losses) from his or her Account by
December&nbsp;31, 2005 and such amount shall be reported as taxable income to the Eligible Director for the 2005 calendar year. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">33 </FONT></P>

</BODY></HTML>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.31
<SEQUENCE>4
<FILENAME>dex1031.htm
<DESCRIPTION>AMENDMENTS TO THE PEPSICO, INC. 2003 LONG-TERM INCENTIVE PLAN
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Amendments to the PepsiCo, Inc. 2003 Long-Term Incentive Plan</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>EXHIBIT 10.31 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><U>AMENDMENTS TO THE PEPSICO, INC. 2003 LONG-TERM INCENTIVE PLAN, </U></B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><U>EFFECTIVE AS OF DECEMBER 31, 2005 </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>A.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Amendments to Long-Term Incentive Plans</U> </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The following amendments are effective as of December&nbsp;31, 2005. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The text of Section&nbsp;7(a)(vi) in the PepsiCo, Inc. 2003 Long-Term
Incentive Plan (the &#147;2003 LTIP&#148;) and the text of any similar provision in any of the &#147;Prior Plans&#148; (as defined in the 2003 LTIP) are hereby entirely replaced with the following: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:15%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Buy Out of Option Gains.</U> At any time
after any Option becomes exercisable, the Committee shall have the right to elect, in its sole discretion and without the consent of the holder thereof, to cancel such Option and to cause PepsiCo to pay to the Participant the excess of the Fair
Market Value of the shares of Common Stock covered by such Option over the Option Exercise Price of such Option at the date the Committee provides written notice (the &#147;Buy Out Notice&#148;) of its intention to exercise such right. Buy outs
pursuant to this provision shall be effected by PepsiCo as promptly as possible after the date of the Buy Out Notice. Payments of buy out amounts shall be made in shares of Common Stock. The number of shares shall be determined by dividing the
amount of the payment to be made by the Fair Market Value of a share of Common Stock at the date of the Buy Out Notice, and by rounding up any fractional share to a whole share. The rights provided by this provision are the exclusive rights that are
available with respect to any Option in the event of a buy out, notwithstanding the terms of any outstanding agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The text of Section&nbsp;11 in the 2003 LTIP and the text of any similar provision in any of the Prior Plans are hereby entirely replaced with the
following: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Change in Control. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Upon a Change in Control, the following shall occur.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) <U>Options.</U> Effective
on the date of such Change in Control, all outstanding and unvested Options granted under the Plan shall immediately vest and become exercisable, and all Options then outstanding under the Plan shall remain outstanding in accordance with their
terms. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Plan, in the event that any Option granted under the Plan becomes unexercisable during its term on or after a Change in Control because: (i)&nbsp;the individual who holds such Option is
involuntarily terminated (other than for cause) within two (2)&nbsp;years after the Change in Control; (ii)&nbsp;such Option is terminated or adversely modified; or (iii)&nbsp;Common Stock is no longer issued and outstanding, or no longer traded on
a national securities exchange, then the holder of such Option shall immediately be entitled to receive equity (e.g., common stock) of the &#147;Acquiring Entity&#148; (as defined below) with a fair market value (taking into account any
marketability limitations) equal to (A)&nbsp;the gain on such Option or (B)&nbsp;only if greater than the gain and only with respect to NQSOs the Black-Scholes value of such Option (as determined by a nationally recognized independent investment
banker chosen by PepsiCo), in either case calculated on the date such Option becomes unexercisable. For purposes of the preceding sentence, the gain on an Option shall be calculated as the difference between the closing price per share of Common
Stock as of the date such Option becomes unexercisable less the Option Exercise Price. </FONT></P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) <U>Stock Appreciation Rights.</U> Effective on the date of such
Change in Control, all outstanding and unvested SARs granted under the Plan shall immediately vest and become exercisable, and all SARs then outstanding under the Plan shall remain outstanding in accordance with their terms. In the event that any
SAR granted under the Plan becomes unexercisable during its term on or after a Change in Control because: (i)&nbsp;the individual who holds such SAR is involuntarily terminated (other than for cause) within two (2)&nbsp;years after the Change in
Control; (ii)&nbsp;such SAR is terminated or adversely modified; or (iii)&nbsp;Common Stock is no longer issued and outstanding, or no longer traded on a national securities exchange, then the holder of such SAR shall immediately be entitled to
receive equity (e.g., common stock) of the Acquiring Entity with a fair market value (taking into account any marketability limitations) equal to the gain on such SAR. For purposes of the preceding sentence, the gain on a SAR shall be calculated as
the difference between the closing price per share of Common Stock as of the date such SAR becomes unexercisable and the purchase price per share of Common Stock covered by the SAR. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(c) <U>Restricted Shares/Restricted Share Units.</U> Upon a Change of Control all Restricted
Shares and Restricted Share Units shall immediately vest and be distributed to Participants, effective as of the date of the Change of Control. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(d) <U>Performance Awards.</U> Each Performance Award granted under the Plan that is outstanding on the date of the Change
in Control shall immediately vest and the holder of such Performance Award shall be entitled to a lump sum cash payment equal to the amount of such Performance Award payable at the end of the Performance Period as if 100% of the Performance Goals
have been achieved. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(e)
<U>Timing of Payment.</U> Any amount required to be paid pursuant to this Section&nbsp;11 shall be paid as soon as practical after the date such amount becomes payable. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(f) <U>Definition.</U> &#147;Change in Control&#148; means the occurrence of any of the
following events: (i)&nbsp;acquisition of 20% or more of the outstanding voting securities of PepsiCo, Inc. by another entity or group; excluding, however, the following (A)&nbsp;any acquisition by PepsiCo, Inc., or (B)&nbsp;any acquisition by an
employee benefit plan or related trust sponsored or maintained by PepsiCo, Inc.; (ii)&nbsp;during any consecutive two-year period, persons who constitute the Board of Directors of PepsiCo, Inc. (the &#147;Board&#148;) at the beginning of the period
cease to constitute at least 50% of the Board (unless the election of each new Board member was approved by a majority of directors who began the two-year period); (iii)&nbsp;PepsiCo, Inc. shareholders approve a merger or consolidation of PepsiCo,
Inc. with another company, and PepsiCo, Inc. is not the surviving company; or, if after such transaction, the other entity owns, directly or indirectly, 50% or more of the outstanding voting securities of PepsiCo, Inc.; (iv)&nbsp;PepsiCo, Inc.
shareholders approve a plan of complete liquidation of PepsiCo, Inc. or the sale or disposition of all or substantially all of PepsiCo, Inc.&#146;s assets; or (v)&nbsp;any other event, circumstance, offer or proposal occurs or is made, which is
intended to effect a change in the control of PepsiCo, Inc., and which results in the occurrence of one or more of the events set forth in clauses (i)&nbsp;through (iv)&nbsp;of this paragraph. For purposes of the Plan, the group or entity that
triggers a Change in Control under cause (i), that is directly or indirectly responsible for the change in the Board under clause (ii), that survives the merger or consolidation referred to in clause (iii), or that acquires the assets under clause
(iv)&nbsp;is referred to as the &#147;Acquiring Entity.&#148; </FONT></P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(g) <U>Exclusive Rights.</U> The rights provided by this Section are the
exclusive rights that are available with respect to any Award in the event of a Change in Control, notwithstanding the terms of any outstanding agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P><DIV
ALIGN="right">
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="40%" BORDER="0">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="3"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Adopted and Approved. PepsiCo, Inc.</FONT></P></TD></TR>

<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>

<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>

</TABLE></DIV>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>B.&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Amendment to SharePower Plan</U> </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The following amendments are effective as of December&nbsp;31, 2005.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Section&nbsp;2(b) in the PepsiCo SharePower Stock Option Plan
(&#147;SharePower Plan&#148;) is hereby entirely replaced with the following: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) &#147;Change in Control&#148; means the occurrence of any of the following events: (i)&nbsp;acquisition of 10% or more of the outstanding voting securities of PepsiCo, Inc. by another entity
or group; excluding, however, the following (A)&nbsp;any acquisition by PepsiCo, Inc., or (B)&nbsp;any acquisition by an employee benefit plan or related trust sponsored or maintained by PepsiCo, Inc.; (ii)&nbsp;during any consecutive two-year
period, persons who constitute the Board of Directors of PepsiCo, Inc. (the &#147;Board&#148;) at the beginning of the period cease to constitute at least 50% of the Board (unless the election of each new Board member was approved by a majority of
directors who began the two-year period); (iii)&nbsp;PepsiCo, Inc. shareholders approve a merger or consolidation of PepsiCo, Inc. with another company, and PepsiCo, Inc. is not the surviving company; or, if after such transaction, the other entity
owns, directly or indirectly, 50% or more of the outstanding voting securities of PepsiCo, Inc.; (iv)&nbsp;PepsiCo, Inc. shareholders approve a plan of complete liquidation of PepsiCo, Inc. or the sale or disposition of all or substantially all of
PepsiCo, Inc.&#146;s assets; or (v)&nbsp;any other event, circumstance, offer or proposal occurs or is made, which is intended to effect a change in the control of PepsiCo, Inc., and which results in the occurrence of one or more of the events set
forth in clauses (i)&nbsp;through (iv)&nbsp;of this Section&nbsp;2(b). For purposes of the Plan, the group or entity that triggers a Change in Control under clause (i), that is directly or indirectly responsible for the change in the Board under
clause (ii), that survives the merger or consolidation referred to in clause (iii), or that acquires the assets under clause (iv)&nbsp;is referred to as the &#147;Acquiring Entity.&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Section&nbsp;6(h) in the SharePower Plan is hereby entirely replaced with the following: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(h) <U>Effect of a Change in Control.</U>
Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Plan, at the date of a Change in Control, all outstanding and unvested Options granted under the Plan shall immediately vest and become exercisable, and all Options then outstanding under the Plan
shall remain outstanding in accordance with their terms. In the event that any Option granted under the Plan becomes unexercisable during its term on or after a Change in Control because: (i)&nbsp;the individual who holds such Option is
involuntarily terminated (other than for cause) within two (2)&nbsp;years after the Change in Control; (ii)&nbsp;such Option is terminated or adversely modified; or (iii)&nbsp;Common Stock is no longer issued and outstanding, or no longer traded on
a national securities exchange, then the holder of such Option shall immediately be entitled to receive equity (e.g., common stock) of the Acquiring Entity with a fair market value (taking into account any marketability limitations) equal to the
greater of (x)&nbsp;the gain on such Option or (B)&nbsp;the Black-Scholes value of such Option (as determined by a nationally recognized independent investment banker chosen by PepsiCo), in either case calculated on the date such Option becomes
unexercisable. For purposes of the preceding sentence, the gain on an Option shall be calculated as the difference between the closing price per share of PepsiCo Common Stock as of the date such Option becomes unexercisable less the Option Exercise
Price of such Option. Any equity required to be provided pursuant to this Section&nbsp;6(h) shall be delivered within twenty (20)&nbsp;days after the date the Option holder becomes entitled to receive such equity. The rights provided by this
Section&nbsp;6(h) are the exclusive rights that are available with respect to any Option in the event of a Change in Control, notwithstanding anything to the contrary. </FONT></P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Section&nbsp;10 in the SharePower Plan is hereby entirely replaced with the following: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">10. <U>Buy Out of Option Gains.</U> At any
time after any Stock Option becomes exercisable, the Committee shall have the right to elect, in its sole discretion and without the consent of the holder thereof, to cancel such Option and to cause PepsiCo to pay to the Optionee the excess of the
Fair Market Value of the shares of Common Stock covered by such Option over the Option Exercise Price of such Option at the date the Committee provides written notice (the &#147;Buy Out Notice&#148;) of its intention to exercise such right. Buy outs
pursuant to this provision shall be effected by PepsiCo as promptly as possible after the date of the Buy Out Notice. Payments of buy out amounts shall be made in shares of Common Stock. The number of shares shall be determined by dividing the
amount of the payment to be made by the Fair Market Value of a share of Common Stock at the date of the Buy Out Notice. In no event shall PepsiCo be required to deliver a fractional share of Common Stock in satisfaction of this buy out provision.
Payments of any such buy out amounts shall be made net of any applicable foreign, federal (including FICA), state and local withholding taxes. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P><DIV
ALIGN="right">
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="40%" BORDER="0">

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">PepsiCo, Inc.</FONT></P></TD></TR>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.32
<SEQUENCE>5
<FILENAME>dex1032.htm
<DESCRIPTION>SUMMARY AND LETTER TO IRENE ROSENFELD DATED JULY 30, 2004
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Summary and Letter to Irene Rosenfeld dated July 30, 2004</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>EXHIBIT 10.32 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><U>Summary of Employment Arrangement with Irene Rosenfeld </U></B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Irene B. Rosenfeld entered into an employment arrangement with PepsiCo to
serve as Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of the Company&#146;s Frito Lay North American division commencing September&nbsp;1, 2004. The employment arrangement does not guarantee employment and either the Company or Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld may
terminate her employment at any time. The employment arrangement provides for a payout equal to one year of base salary and bonus should she be involuntarily terminated (other than for cause) within the first three years of her employment.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The arrangement provided Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld with relocation
benefits generally available to all employees to facilitate her relocation from Chicago to Dallas. She was also granted $1 million in Restricted Stock Units with one-year service-based vesting. The award vested on September 1, 2005 and converted to
common shares, less applicable taxes. The shares are currently being held by Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld in furtherance of her share ownership requirements. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">As part of the arrangement, Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld is eligible to receive salary, bonus, long-term incentives and other benefits as described in the attached
offer letter. Her bonus and long-term incentives are awarded based on performance and all elements of her compensation, including salary, are subject to yearly review by the Board of Directors based on the Company&#146;s and
Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld&#146;s performance. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld
participates in the same retirement program as other salaried employees and will be eligible for full retirement at age 62 after ten years of service. At that time, as part of the arrangement, she will receive an additional 10 years of credited
service when determining her retirement benefit. </FONT></P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">700 Anderson Hill Road Purchase, New York 10577 <U>www.pepsico.com</U> </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center">

<IMG SRC="g9190691906img.jpg" ALT="LOGO"> </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">DAVID E. SCHERB </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">VICE PRESIDENT </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">July&nbsp;30, 2004 </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Ms.&nbsp;Irene Rosenfeld </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">862 Greenwood Avenue </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Glencoe, IL 60022
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Dear Irene: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">We are pleased to confirm our offer for you to join PepsiCo as Chairman and
Chief Executive Officer of Frito-Lay North America, reporting to Steve Reinemund, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of PepsiCo, Inc. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The primary details of your offer are as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Start Date</B>: Your start date will be September&nbsp;1, 2004. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Salary</B>: Your starting annual base salary will be $775,000. Your annual base salary will be reviewed each year beginning in 2005.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Bonus</B>: Each year you will be eligible to participate in our Executive Incentive Compensation Plan (EICP), which provides two bonus opportunities. First,
an <B>Annual Bonus </B>with a target of 150% of your base salary and which is payable in the year following the bonus year. Second, a <B>Premium Bonus </B>with a target of 50% of your base salary and which vests and is payable in thirds over three
years following the bonus year. Bonuses under the EICP are approved by the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors and paid out at 0% - 200% of target, depending on business and personal performance. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:3%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">For four months employment in 2004, both bonuses will be
paid based on no less than 100% target performance and pro-rated to pay out 33% of the full year amounts. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Long-Term Incentive Program</B>: You will be eligible to participate in Long-Term Incentives applicable to other similarly situated executives at PepsiCo. The
size and terms of awards under the LTIP are determined by the Compensation Committee. The following is a summary of the Initial Grants and New Hire Grant that the Compensation Committee of PepsiCo&#146;s Board of Directors has already approved for
you, and a summary of Future Grants you would eligible for. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Initial Grants</B>: On your hire date, you will receive an award under the terms of the LTIP with a value of $578,800 split 50%/50% between Stock Options and
Restricted Stock Units. The Stock Options will have a face value of $1,157,500, and the actual number of options you are granted will be determined by dividing the face value by the fair market value of PepsiCo common stock on September&nbsp;1,
2004. The Restricted Stock Units will have an award value of $289,400, and the actual number of units you are granted will be determined by dividing the award value by the fair market value of PepsiCo common stock on September&nbsp;1, 2004.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">700 Anderson Hill Road Purchase, New York 10577 <U>www.pepsico.com</U> </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center">

<IMG SRC="g9190691906img.jpg" ALT="LOGO"> </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Ms. Irene Rosenfeld </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">July 30, 2004 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Page 2 </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>New Hire Gran</B>t: On your hire date, you will receive an award under the terms of the LTIP with a value of $1,000,000, which will be entirely in restricted
Stock Units. The actual number of units you are granted will be determined by dividing the award value by the fair market value of PepsiCo common stock on September&nbsp;1, 2004. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Future Grants</B>: Under the current terms of the LTIP, beginning in 2005, you will be eligible to receive an annual award with a target value of $1,378,000,
or such other amount commensurate with similarly situated executives of PepsiCo, split 50%/50% between Stock Options and Restricted Stock Units. The actual value of the award will be determined by the Board of Directors, taking into account market
conditions and individual and team performance. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Vesting</B>: Under the current terms of the LTIP, on the third anniversary of the grant date, Stock Options become vested and exercisable. Also, Restricted
Units become unrestricted and payable on the third anniversary, assuming that PepsiCo achieves its three-year RSU performance goals set by the Board of Directors. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:3%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">For your 2004 Initial Grant, the option vesting dates and RSU performance criteria will be the same as other
senior executives who received their awards on February&nbsp;1, 2004. This means your awards will vest in two years and five months on February&nbsp;1, 2007, rather than three years. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:3%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">For your 2004 Hire Grant, your Restricted Shock Units will vest after one year on September&nbsp;1, 2005.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:3%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Vesting of your Options and Restricted Stock
Units will accelerate in the event of your death or total disability. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Term</B>: Options typically expire after 10 years. Because they are granted during the year, your 2004 options will have a 9 year and 5 month term and will
expire February&nbsp;1, 2014. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Exercisability</B>: In the event of your retirement, death or disability, your vested options would remain exercisable for their entire term. In the event of
any other termination of employment, your vested options would have to be exercised prior to your termination date. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>SharePower</B>: You will be eligible for additional grants of stock options under the LTIP equal to the options you would receive under PepsiCo&#146;s
SharePower Stock Option Program if you were eligible to participate in that program. You will first be eligible for SharePower grants in 2005. SharePower grants typically vest after three years, but would vest fully upon your retirement.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Deferred Compensation</B>: You will be eligible to participate in PepsiCo&#146;s Executive Income Deferral Program (EID), under which you are permitted to
defer up to 100% of your base salary and annual bonus. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Executive Car Program</B>: You will be eligible to participate in PepsiCo&#146;s Executive Car Program, which generally covers your costs of leasing and
maintaining an automobile of your choice (with certain limitations). In lieu of leasing an automobile, you may choose to receive a cash car allowance. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Active Health Benefits</B>: You will be eligible to participate in PepsiCo&#146;s benefits plan for salaried employees. Under this plan, PepsiCo pays a
portion of the costs of medical, dental and vision / hearing coverage as well as basic disability and life insurance benefits. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">700 Anderson Hill Road Purchase, New York 10577 <U>www.pepsico.com</U> </FONT></P> <P

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">July 30, 2004 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Page 3 </FONT></P> <P

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Home Purchase Policy</B>: You will be eligible for our standard policy for home sale / purchase / mortgage assistance. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Relocation Package</B>: You will be covered by our standard relocation policy, which covers your actual relocation costs (e.g. traveling, shipping goods,
temporary living) and provides you with a $62,500 cash allowance. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Pension</B>: In accordance with applicable plans, you will be eligible for a retirement pension if you terminate employment (other than for cause) after
completing at least ten years of service. Upon completion of ten years of service, you will receive ten years of &#147;additional credited service&#148; that will be added to your total years of actual service when calculating your total pension
benefit. The amount of your pension benefit will be calculated in accordance with PepsiCo&#146;s Pension Equalization Plan. Vesting occurs after five years, but vested benefits will not include the additional credited service mentioned above until
ten years of actual service are completed. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Retiree Health Benefits</B>: In accordance with applicable plans, if you terminate employment (other than for cause) after completing ten years of service,
you will be eligible to participate in PepsiCo&#146;s retiree medical benefits program. Under the current program, PepsiCo pays a portion of the costs of medical coverage. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Severance</B>: In the event of your involuntary termination (other than for cause) during the first three years of employment, you will receive a lump sump
severance payment equal to not less than one year of Base Salary and Target Annual Bonus (150% of Base Salary). </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Term of Employment</B>: Nothing in this offer serves as a guarantee of employment for any fixed length of time, and either you or PepsiCo may terminate your
employment at any time. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The above describes
the primary terms of our offer and PepsiCo&#146;s Compensation and Benefits Programs. The terms and conditions of these programs are governed by the formal legal documents. For your information, I have enclosed a one-page summary of your
compensation and copies of the Executive Compensation, Deferred Compensation and Executive Car Programs. </FONT></P>

and hope that you view our offer as an indication of our confidence in your success. We know you will be a strong addition to our team and believe you will find your experience at PepsiCo to be challenging, rewarding and fun. Please acknowledge your
acceptance of the above offer by signing below and returning this letter to me via fax at 914-253-3008 or mail. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me at 914-253-3862 or Peggy Moore at 914-253-3007. </FONT></P> <P

<FILENAME>dex24.htm
<DESCRIPTION>POWER OF ATTORNEY
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Power of Attorney</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>EXHIBIT 24 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>POWER OF ATTORNEY </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">PepsiCo, Inc. (&#147;PepsiCo&#148;) and each of the undersigned, an officer or director, or both, of PepsiCo, do hereby appoint Larry D. Thompson, Robert
E. Cox and Thomas H. Tamoney, Jr. and each of them severally, its, his or her true and lawful attorney-in-fact to execute on behalf of PepsiCo and the undersigned the following documents and any and all amendments thereto (including post-effective
amendments): </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(i)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Registration Statements No.&nbsp;33-53232, 33-64243 and 333-102035 relating to the offer and sale of PepsiCo&#146;s Debt Securities, Warrants and Guarantees;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(ii)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Registration Statements No.&nbsp;33-4635, 33-21607, 33-30372, 33-31844, 33-37271, 33-37978, 33-47314, 33-47527, 333-53436 and 333-56302 all relating to the
primary and/or secondary offer and sale of PepsiCo Common Stock issued or exchanged in connection with acquisition transactions; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(iii)</FONT></TD>

PepsiCo Common Stock under the PepsiCo SharePower Stock Option Plan; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

or the PepsiCo Long-Term Savings Program; Registration Statement No.&nbsp;333-56524 relating to the offer and sale of PepsiCo Common Stock under the PepsiCo Puerto Rico 1165(e) Plan; Registration Statement No.&nbsp;333-65992 relating to the offer
and sale of PepsiCo Common Stock under the Retirement Savings and Investment Plan for Union Employees of Tropicana Products, Inc. and Affiliates (Teamsters Local Union #173), the Retirement Savings and Investment Plan for Union Employees of
Tropicana Products, Inc. and Affiliates; Registration Statement No.&nbsp;333-66634 relating to the offer and sale of PepsiCo Common Stock under The Quaker 401(k) Plan for Salaried Employees and The Quaker 401(k) Plan for Hourly Employees;
